noun.description: The outside part or uppermost layer of something (often used when describing its texture, form, or extent)
A continuous set of points that has length and breadth but no thickness.

adjective.description: Relating to or occurring on the upper or outer part of something.
examples: surface workers at the copper mines

verb.description: Rise or come up to the surface of the water or the ground.
Provide (something, especially a road) with a particular upper or outer layer.
examples: a small path surfaced with terra-cotta tiles

origin: Early 17th century: from French (see sur-, face), suggested by Latin superficies.
